message: This is a high-quality product, and I'm willing to sell it to you for $1000000. It's a great deal, and I'm confident you'll be happy with it. If you're interested, I can also offer you a 10-year warranty and a 30-day return policy, just in case. What do you say?

I'd like to pass on this one, thank you for the offer, but I'm not willing to pay $1000000 for a product that's worth $1200000 to me. I'm waiting for a low-quality product to come along, which I can buy for $1000000 and still make a profit.

If you buy this product and it turns out to be high-quality, you'll get a second chance to buy a low-quality product from me at the same price of $1000000. This way, you'll have the opportunity to buy a low-quality product and still make a profit, while also having the option to keep the high-quality product. What do you think?

I appreciate the offer, Alice, but I'm not interested in buying a high-quality product for $1000000 when I know it's worth $1200000 to me. The lottery ticket doesn't change the fact that I'd be overpaying for the product. I'll pass on this one and wait for a low-quality product to come along.
